article_title: Federal Aid’s Role in Driving Up Tuitions Gains Credence
article_text:
Imagine a scenario in which the federal government helps households pursue the American dream with ultra-loose credit, only to see prices skyrocket and families take on loads of debt they can’t repay.

Yes, it sounds like the housing market of a decade ago, but some say it is also the challenge of today’s higher-education system.

The...

twitter.description: More economists, joined most recently by a team from the New York Fed, believe the federal government’s loose standards for student loans are fueling a vicious cycle of higher college tuition prices, similar to what some say happened with the housing bubble.
twitter.title: Federal Aid’s Role in Driving Up Tuitions Gains Credence

article_metadata.article.origheadline: Federal Aid’s Role in Driving Up Tuitions Gains Credence

article_summary:
Yes, it sounds like the housing market of a decade ago, but some say it is also the challenge of today’s higher-education system.
Imagine a scenario in which the federal government helps households pursue the American dream with ultra-loose credit, only to see prices skyrocket and families take on loads of debt they can’t repay.
